Key Match Events: Dereck Lively II led the rally with 13 points in the final frame.
Dallas uncorked a 16-0 blast that was capped off by Quentin Grimes’ floater that pushed the Mavs ahead 115-109.
Portland didn’t score again until Camara evaded PJ Washington for a dunk with 26.1 seconds left in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Without the Doncic-Irving tandem, the Mavericks relied on a balanced attack to pull out the win.
Post-Match Reflections: "Unbelievable tank job" - NBA fans react to the Trail Blazers' collapse that allowed the Mavs to escape with a win.
Following Thursday’s loss, the Dallas Mavericks won the season series 3-1 against the Portland Trail Blazers.
The Blazers pulled off a 126-122 upset on Dec. 28 despite Kyrie Irving erupting for 46 points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anfernee Simons went 0-of-4 in the last four minutes and committed two turnovers.
During the same stretch, Shaedon Sharpe went 0-of-2, committing three fouls and two turnovers.
